page.title: 13Amenities
page.content: {VILLAGE HALL} A public meeting called by the Vicar Rev. Hatt Lipscombe on Aug.30th 1946 was to decide whether to build a hall, or buy land for a playing field,or both The meeting decided to do both the in- come from the hall going to the upkeep of the field. The cricket pitch turf was given by Barton Stud. The hall seats 200 and is hired out for all kinds of social gatherings. The committee this year has begun expansion of the facilities:shower/changing rooms store room more toilets,etc. {CHURCH INSTITUTE} This was built by the Bunbury Family.It seats approx. 80 and is let out for social gatherings and meetings. {POST OFFICE & STORES} This is a full Post Office except for Road Fund Licence Issue and is still a typical village centre.
